citation.article-title: Aeromonas culicicola sp. nov., from the midgut of Culex quinquefasciatus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aeromonas culicicola sp. nov.

Aeromonas culicicola (cu.li'ci.co.la. N.L. n. Culicidae name of a family of mosquitoes; L. suffix -cola inhabitant of; N.L. n. culicicola inhabitant of Culicidae, to denote the family of the insect hosts from which the species was first isolated)
Cells are Gram-negative, straight, motile rods with a polar flagellum.
Oxidase-and catalase-positive, reduces nitrate to nitrite and is resistant to the vibriostatic agent O/129.

Shows positive reactions for DNase, Voges-Proskauer test, indole production from tryptophan, alkalinization of citrate, lysine decarboxylation, arginine dihydrolase, ONPG, gelatinase and amylase production.
No production of ornithine decarboxylase or urease.
Optimal growth occurs after 18 h at 30°C, but can also grow at 37°C in LB broth.
Haemolytic activity is observed after 18 h incubation at 37°C.

The type strain utilizes the following substrates as sole carbon and energy sources: starch, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, D-glycerol, glycogen, D-maltose, D-mannitol, melibiose, D-mannose, N-acetyl glucosamine, D-sucrose and D-ribose.
Uniform acid production is observed with all these substrates.

Does not produce acid from adonitol, amygdalin, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, arbutin, methyl aglucoside, methyl α-mannoside, α-gentiobiose, methyl β-xyloside, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, aesculin, dfucose, L-fucose, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, lactose, D-lyxose, melezitose, D-raffinose, rhamnose, salicin, sorbitol, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, D-turanose, xylitol or D-xylose.
The type strain is resistant to ampicillin and amikacin and sensitive to cefadroxil, cefriaxone, cefuroxime, ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin.
It shows intermediate resistance to cefoperazone, cefotaxime, cotrimoxazole, erythromycin, gentamicin, netilmicin and penicillin.

The 16S rRNA gene sequence of the type strain is highly similar to all known sequences of A. jandaei, with a single base difference at position 264, while DNA-DNA hybridization studies separate it from A. jandaei (54% similarity).
It shows highest similarity to A. sobria (61%).

The type strain has been deposited at the Microbial Type Culture Collection at Institute of Microbial Technology, Chandigarh, India, as strain MTCC 3249T and at the National Collection of Industrial Micro-organisms, National Chemical Laboratory, Pune, India, as strain NCIM 5147T.
